intro: Camphora camelliifolia, commonly known as the Chinese camphor tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and as a source of camphor. The tree is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
